chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:
items.plainText: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:

items.text: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.
items.plainText: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

items.text: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.
items.plainText: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.

items.text: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.
items.plainText: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.

items.text: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.
items.plainText: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

items.text: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:
items.plainText: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:

items.text: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.
items.plainText: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

items.text: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.
items.plainText: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

items.text: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
items.plainText: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

items.text: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
items.plainText: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

items.text: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.
items.plainText: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

items.text: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
items.plainText: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

items.text: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.
items.plainText: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

items.text: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
items.plainText: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.

items.text: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.
items.plainText: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

items.text: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.
items.plainText: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

items.text: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.
items.plainText: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.

items.text: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.
items.plainText: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

items.text: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.
items.plainText: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.

items.text: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:
items.plainText: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

items.text: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.
items.plainText: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.

items.text: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.
items.plainText: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

items.text: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
items.plainText: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

items.text: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.
items.plainText: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

items.text: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.
items.plainText: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.

items.text: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.
items.plainText: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

items.text: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
items.plainText: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

items.text: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.
items.plainText: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.

items.text: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?
items.plainText: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?

items.text: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.
items.plainText: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.

items.text: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.
items.plainText: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.

items.text: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.
items.plainText: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

items.text: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.
items.plainText: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.

items.text: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
items.plainText: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

items.text: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
items.plainText: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
